subject: RE: [junit] JUnit help
msgSnippet: I m curious why you re not using ant for this?
messageBody:
I'm curious why you're not using ant for this?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bill de hÓra [mailto:dehora@...]
> Sent: Saturday, November 30, 2002 9:59 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit help
>
>
> yourloveravi wrote:
> > Hi All,
> >
> > Regarding JUnit I have a question that can we gather all
> information
> > of a test and print those in our customized html format
> without using
> > ANT scripting. I need to gather information like
> > 1. name of Class.
> > 2. name of method testXXXX
> > 3. errors and failures( I can get from TestResult)
> > 4. A short description for the method which the tester will
> write in
> > each testmethod testXXX.
> >
> > This is urgent. Please reply as soon as possible.
>
> "That's your problem, not ours."
>
> Please read this document:
>
> <http://www.tuxedo.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html>
>
> Bill de hÓra
>
> [The answer btw is yes, but you'll need to write some code to do so.
> Start by looking at how Ant generates test reports.]
>
>
